name: Libertel Gare du Nord Suede

reviews.text: looking for a hotel in a complicated last minute trip, i read these good reviews about this hotel.
reviews.title: better hotels can be found at same price

reviews.text: it didn’t work out like that at all. a recap of why.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Very well priced hotel

reviews.text: cheap: i paid 70euros per night, the official price is 185euros, that would be too expensive.
reviews.title: Excellent comfy hotel

reviews.text: convenient: if you arrive late in paris by eurostar: 5 mins walking distance from gare du nord
reviews.title: Definitely worth it, would love to return!

reviews.text: After leaving a very poor hotel we searched quickly and found a triple room here. A quick walk and we were greeted by one of the friendliest people I have ever met on the reception desk. A quick chat about we needed a room for the night and we were set. When we return to Paris we will definitely stay here again. Room was great and breakfast just right. Fullmarks to the staff. One of the top hotels on my list from now on.
reviews.title: You can't get better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there in October 2010. Picked it due to conveneient location - our trains were from Gare Du Nord. By the way, Monmartre is just 4 bus stops from the hotel. The rooms were rather small and clean, breakfast was of no value at all, the service was OK.
reviews.title: Cheap, basic, good location

reviews.text: One problem in our room was the sound of water in heating system, which was very annoying in early morning.
reviews.title: cheap, but no atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would recommend it, if you are looking for a basic stopover with no extras. The price / quality ratio is quite resonable.
reviews.title: Perfect location, best cost benefit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Gare du Nord for three nights, partly because it is so convenient to the train station where you catch the RER for the airport - it's a 6 minute walk up the street. The room was small (but I've seen smaller) and very clean. It was quiet, aside from a few banging doors in the hallway throughout one evening, the night was quiet. The breakfast, which I only had once, was not really worth it, the coffee was just terrible and the choices very limited - better to head out and sit at a cafe up the street. I was able to check in early, which was a good thing. The desk clerk was less than helpful when I couldn't get the internet to work, and I had already paid. He did refund my 5 euro after I asked three times, but declined to put a note on the computer for other guests.
reviews.title: A great medium priced hotel

reviews.text: Great location,only a few minutes walk from Gare du Nord and Gare du Est and the Metro stations. Convenient if arriving at CDG. Take train to Gare Du Nord and short walk to hotel. The room was small but this is common in Paris. I reminded me of a cruise ship room. It is clean with modern decor and bathroom. Free WiFi and cable TV. Breakfast is 8 euro. The price is moderate for Paris. The area around the hotel is commercial and safe, but doesn't have the charm of the Latin Quarter or St Germain.
reviews.title: Small, clean room, great location

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because it is a 2 minute walk from Gard du Nord, so very convenient. Although the hotel has been refurbished it's to an average standard with some odd colour choices (avocado green bathroom!). Our room was quite small despite supposedly being a triple. Not somewhere you'd want to stay for any length of time. As it was we were just there overnight so it was fine for us.
reviews.title: Excellent location - ok accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from moving us to a room i hadn't booked, it was a alright stay. rooms are basic but clean, and most are a reasonable size. Breakfast was just basic cereal and coffee etc. Location is easy for Gare de Nord, 5 mins walk. Walls are abit thin, you can hear the phones ringing in the next room.
reviews.title: Clean and ok service

reviews.text: Good location close to Gare du Nord/Metro (5 min walk). Many hotels in area and several internet cafes (makes calling home cheap and easy!). Room small (typical of europe) but quite modern. Flat screen TV, kettle, hairdryer. Decent shower (small) Staff overall helpful. Only had one day of stay noted in their records when I needed 2 - were quick to help. View of Sacre-Coeur from window. Did not try breakfast - additional cost and there are a couple of bakeries in neighborhood.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.text: I have just spent 5 nights at this hotel and it is in a very convenient position to Gard du Nord which is why I picked it along with the Wifi access which only worked intermittently and had to sit in small lobby to get a connection
reviews.title: Find a better place to stay in a safer area closer to sites
Good basic hotel close to the train station
reviews.text: Nice hotel, not much of a view from my room number 207, it looked over a courtyard but no sound of traffic from the road.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room looked like it was just redecorated it was small but nice and clean.
reviews.title: Great location; immaculate, no frills hotel; good value

reviews.text: Breakfast was just ok but they only put enough tea/coffee in the rooms for one serving only.
reviews.title: An excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff nice and friendly, its just 4.5 Euros to hire a safe box for your valuables.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect

reviews.text: The area is not that great but not that bad either, this was a budget trip so I did not come back to the hotel late at night.
reviews.title: Good location, clean & good value

aka: Libertel Gare Du Nord Suede Hotel
description: Stylish and welcoming, the Hotel Gare du Nord Suède is located between the Gare du Nord and the Gare de l’Est, 5 min from the Stade de France, 15 min from the Parc des Expositions de Villepinte, 25 min from Roissy Charles de Gaulle Airport by the RER line B, close to department stores, the grands boulevards and the Musée Grévin. Works of art are exhibited in the Hotel's hall giving it an interesting and original atmosphere.
